title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
text: Read table GDL_Orders find inconsistencies:
code: problems(o) %>% datatable() o %>%   group_by(ResponsibleP3) %>%   summarize(     OrderCount = n(),     TotalNumberOrdered = sum(NumberOrdered)   ) %>%   datatable()

title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
code: o %>%   group_by(ResponsibleP3) %>%   summarize(     OrderCount = n(),     TotalNumberOrdered = sum(NumberOrdered)   ) %>%   datatable()

title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
text: orderName: OrderName present GDL_Order: GDL_ID Duplicate GDL_ID OrderName: Duplicate GDL_ID ():
code: d <- read_gdl_data("/Users/rafnuss/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/geolocator_data/UNIT_Vogelzug/database/GDL_Data.csv") problems(d) %>% datatable() d %>%   filter(is.na(d$OrderName)) %>%   datatable() d %>%   group_by(OrderName) %>%   summarize(     GDLCount = n()   ) %>%   filter(!(OrderName %in% o$OrderName)) %>%   datatable() d %>%   filter(is.na(GDL_ID)) %>%   datatable() d %>%   group_by(GDL_ID, OrderName) %>%   filter(n() > 1) %>%   ungroup() %>%   arrange(GDL_ID) %>%   datatable() d %>%   group_by(GDL_ID) %>%   filter(n() > 1) %>%   ungroup() %>%   arrange(GDL_ID) %>%   datatable() d %>%   group_by(GDL_Type, FirmwareVersion, HardwareVersion) %>%   summarize(.groups = "keep", countTag = n()) %>%   datatable() d %>%   filter(is.na(GDL_Type) | is.na(FirmwareVersion) | is.na(HardwareVersion)) %>%   datatable() d %>%   group_by(Species) %>%   summarize(countTag = n()) %>%   arrange(countTag) %>%   datatable()

title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
text: orderName: OrderName present GDL_Order:
code: d %>%   filter(is.na(d$OrderName)) %>%   datatable() d %>%   group_by(OrderName) %>%   summarize(     GDLCount = n()   ) %>%   filter(!(OrderName %in% o$OrderName)) %>%   datatable()

title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
text: GDL_ID Duplicate GDL_ID OrderName: Duplicate GDL_ID ():
code: d %>%   filter(is.na(GDL_ID)) %>%   datatable() d %>%   group_by(GDL_ID, OrderName) %>%   filter(n() > 1) %>%   ungroup() %>%   arrange(GDL_ID) %>%   datatable() d %>%   group_by(GDL_ID) %>%   filter(n() > 1) %>%   ungroup() %>%   arrange(GDL_ID) %>%   datatable()

title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
code: d %>%   group_by(GDL_Type, FirmwareVersion, HardwareVersion) %>%   summarize(.groups = "keep", countTag = n()) %>%   datatable() d %>%   filter(is.na(GDL_Type) | is.na(FirmwareVersion) | is.na(HardwareVersion)) %>%   datatable()

title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
code: d %>%   group_by(Species) %>%   summarize(countTag = n()) %>%   arrange(countTag) %>%   datatable()

title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
text: -> folder subfolder structure?
code: tibble(filename = list.files("/Users/rafnuss/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/geolocator_data/UNIT_Vogelzug/data/", recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE)) %>%   mutate(ext = tools::file_ext(filename)) %>%   group_by(ext) %>%   summarise(count = n()) %>%   arrange(count) %>%   datatable() for (i in seq_len(nrow(d))) {   if (is.na(d$GDL_ID[i])) {     next   }   folder <- list.files(glue::glue("./data/{d$OrderName[i]}/"), pattern = d$GDL_ID[i])    if (length(folder) == 1) {     d$gdl_id_version <- folder   } else if (any(grepl(".glf", folder))) {     d$gdl_id_version <- folder[1]   } else if (length(folder) > 1) {     print(folder)   } }

title: Check SOI GDL Access Dataset
code: tibble(filename = list.files("/Users/rafnuss/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/geolocator_data/UNIT_Vogelzug/data/", recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE)) %>%   mutate(ext = tools::file_ext(filename)) %>%   group_by(ext) %>%   summarise(count = n()) %>%   arrange(count) %>%   datatable() for (i in seq_len(nrow(d))) {   if (is.na(d$GDL_ID[i])) {     next   }   folder <- list.files(glue::glue("./data/{d$OrderName[i]}/"), pattern = d$GDL_ID[i])    if (length(folder) == 1) {     d$gdl_id_version <- folder   } else if (any(grepl(".glf", folder))) {     d$gdl_id_version <- folder[1]   } else if (length(folder) > 1) {     print(folder)   } }

title: Create from GeoPressureTemplate
text: can generate GeoLocator Data Package GeoPressureTemplate folder create_gldp_geopressuretemplate(). function read DESCRIPTION file create frictionless package metadata. stage, data added package. Additional metadata can added edited.
code: directory <- "/Users/rafnuss/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-Vogelwarte/WoodlandKingfisher" pkg <- create_gldp_geopressuretemplate(directory) # There are no embargo by default (1970-01-01) pkg$embargo <- "2030-01-01"  # And the url to an image describing your datapackage pkg$image <- NULL # You can also add keywords: pkg$keywords <- c("Woodland Kingfisher", "intra-african", "multi-sensor geolocator") # Add DOI of the datapackage if already available or reserve it https://help.zenodo.org/docs/deposit/describe-records/reserve-doi/#reserve-doi pkg$id <- "https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11207141" # Provide the recommended citation for the package pkg$citation <- "Nussbaumer, R., & Rime, Y. (2024). Woodland Kingfisher: Migration route and timing of South African Woodland Kingfisher (v1.1). Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11207141" # Funding sources pkg$grants <- c("Swiss Ornithological Intitute") # Identifiers of resources related to the package (e.g. papers, project pages, derived datasets, APIs, etc.). pkg$relatedIdentifiers <- NULL # List of references related to the package pkg$references <- NULL pkg$reference_location <- list(   lat = 45.211,   lon = 34.25 )

title: Create from GeoPressureTemplate
text: creating package, can add data package. present, data read preferentially interim RData files. Warning RData files data generated GeoPressureR workflow functions geopressuretemplate(). Read GeoPressureManual. haven’t run GeoPressureR workflow still want create GeoLocator Data package raw data, can still use add_gldp_geopressuretempate ="raw-tag", reading directly data “./data/raw-tag/”.
code: pkg <- pkg %>%   add_gldp_geopressuretemplate(directory) print(pkg) #> A GeoLocator Data Package with 7 resourcess: #> • tags #> • observations #> • measurements #> • twilights #> • staps #> • paths #> • edges #> Use `unclass()` to print the Data Package as a list. create_gldp_geopressuretemplate(directory) %>%   add_gldp_geopressuretemplate(directory, from = "raw-tag") #> ⠙ 1/5 ETA: 11s | #> ⠹ 2/5 ETA:  8s | #> ⠸ 4/5 ETA:  3s | #> A GeoLocator Data Package with 3 resourcess: #> • tags #> • observations #> • measurements #> Use `unclass()` to print the Data Package as a list.

title: Create from GeoPressureTemplate
text: Finally, can check package ensure compliant GeoLocator Data Package standard.
code: check_gldp(pkg) #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage profile ── #>  #> ✔ $schema is valid. #> ✔ licenses is valid. #> ✔ licenses[[1]] is valid. #> ✔ title is valid. #> ✔ contributors is valid. #> ✔ contributors[[1]] is valid. #> ✔ contributors[[2]] is valid. #> ✔ embargo is valid. #> ✔ name is valid. #> ✔ description is valid. #> ✔ homepage is valid. #> ✔ version is valid. #> ✔ resources is valid. #> ✔ resources[[1]] is valid. #> ✔ resources[[2]] is valid. #> ✔ resources[[3]] is valid. #> ✔ resources[[4]] is valid. #> ✔ resources[[5]] is valid. #> ✔ resources[[6]] is valid. #> ✔ resources[[7]] is valid. #> ✔ created is valid. #> ✔ keywords is valid. #> ✔ keywords[[1]] is valid. #> ✔ keywords[[2]] is valid. #> ✔ keywords[[3]] is valid. #> ✔ id is valid. #> ✔ citation is valid. #> ✔ grants is valid. #> ✔ grants[[1]] is valid. #> ✔ reference_location is valid. #> ✔ reference_location$lat is valid. #> ✔ reference_location$lon is valid. #> ✔ temporal is valid. #> ✔ temporal$start is valid. #> ✔ temporal$end is valid. #> ✔ taxonomic is valid. #> ✔ taxonomic[[1]] is valid. #> ✔ Package is consistent with the profile. #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage Resources #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage Resources tags ── #>  #> ✔ tags$tag_id is valid. #> ✔ tags$ring_number is valid. #> ✔ tags$scientific_name is valid. #> ✔ tags$manufacturer is valid. #> ✔ tags$model is valid. #> ✔ tags$firwmare is valid. #> ✔ tags$weight is valid. #> ✔ tags$attachment_type is valid. #> ✔ tags$readout_method is valid. #> ✔ tags$tag_comments is valid. #> ✔ Table tags is consistent with the schema. #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage Resources observations ── #>  #> ✔ observations$ring_number is valid. #> ✔ observations$tag_id is valid. #> ✔ observations$observation_type is valid. #> ✔ observations$datetime is valid. #> ✔ observations$latitude is valid. #> ✔ observations$longitude is valid. #> ✔ observations$location_name is valid. #> ✔ observations$device_status is valid. #> ✔ observations$observer is valid. #> ✔ observations$catching_method is valid. #> ✔ observations$life_stage is valid. #> ✔ observations$sex is valid. #> ✔ observations$condition is valid. #> ✔ observations$mass is valid. #> ✔ observations$wing_length is valid. #> ✔ observations$additional_metric is valid. #> ✔ observations$observation_comments is valid. #> ✔ Table observations is consistent with the schema. #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage Resources measurements ── #>  #> ✔ measurements$tag_id is valid. #> ✖ measurements$sensor has 224911 items that are not in the allowed values: #> "light, pressure, activity, pitch, temperature, airtemperature, acceleration_x, acceleration_y, acceleration_z, magnetic_x, magnetic_y, magnetic_z". Invalid value: #> "temperature_external" #> ✔ measurements$datetime is valid. #> ✔ measurements$value is valid. #> ✔ measurements$label is valid. #> ✖ Table measurements is not consistent with the schema. #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage Resources twilights ── #>  #> ✔ twilights$tag_id is valid. #> ✔ twilights$twilight is valid. #> ✔ twilights$rise is valid. #> ✔ twilights$label is valid. #> ✔ Table twilights is consistent with the schema. #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage Resources staps ── #>  #> ✔ staps$tag_id is valid. #> ✔ staps$stap_id is valid. #> ✔ staps$start is valid. #> ✔ staps$end is valid. #> ✔ staps$known_lat is valid. #> ✔ staps$known_lon is valid. #> ✔ staps$include is valid. #> ✔ Table staps is consistent with the schema. #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage Resources paths ── #>  #> ✔ paths$tag_id is valid. #> ✔ paths$stap_id is valid. #> ✔ paths$type is valid. #> ✔ paths$lat is valid. #> ✔ paths$lon is valid. #> ✔ paths$ind is valid. #> ✔ paths$j is valid. #> ✔ paths$interp is valid. #> ✔ paths$known is valid. #> ✔ Table paths is consistent with the schema. #>  #> ── Check GeoLocator DataPackage Resources edges ── #>  #> ✔ edges$tag_id is valid. #> ✔ edges$stap_s is valid. #> ✔ edges$stap_t is valid. #> ✔ edges$lat_s is valid. #> ✔ edges$lon_s is valid. #> ✔ edges$lat_t is valid. #> ✔ edges$lon_t is valid. #> ✔ edges$s is valid. #> ✔ edges$t is valid. #> ✔ edges$j is valid. #> ✔ edges$start is valid. #> ✔ edges$end is valid. #> ✔ edges$n is valid. #> ✔ edges$distance is valid. #> ✔ edges$bearing is valid. #> ✔ edges$gs_u is valid. #> ✔ edges$gs_v is valid. #> ✔ edges$ws_u is valid. #> ✔ edges$ws_v is valid. #> ✔ Table edges is consistent with the schema. #> ✖ Package's ressources validation failed. #> ✖ Package validation failed.

title: Create from GeoPressureTemplate
text: package ready, can write disk.
code: write_package(pkg, file.path("~/", pkg$name))

title: Create from SOI
text: contract/agreement, following terms specify: List contributor email giving access write datapackage zenodo still embargo Licenses data according agreement Embargo date according agreement simple example create geolocator data package based basic information: Read datapackage specification learn recommended metadata can added. can added create_gldp() update manually pkg directly : ’re done, can visual can export datapackage.json : Tip Save file root project folder Z: drive
code: pkg <- create_gldp(   title = "Geolocator study of {species_name} in {location}", # required   contributors = list( # required     list(       title = "Raphaël Nussbaumer",       roles = c("ContactPerson", "DataCurator", "ProjectLeader"),       email = "raphael.nussbaumer@vogelwarte.ch",       path = "https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8185-1020",       organization = "Swiss Ornithological Institute"     ),     list(       title = "Yann Rime",       roles = c("Researcher"),       email = "yann.rimme@vogelwarte.ch",       path = "https://orcid.org/0009-0005-7264-6753",       organization = "Swiss Ornithological Institute"     )   ),   # The default licenses is a Creative Common   licenses = list(list(     name = "CC-BY-4.0",     title = "Creative Commons Attribution 4.0",     path = "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/"   )),   # This is the default value, set to a past date so that there are no embargo   embargo = "1970-01-01" ) # Description is really important to provide some textual background information on the project. pkg$description <- "Geolocator study of Mangrove Kingfisher and Red-capped Robin-chat on the coast of Kenya" # If you have a website link, it's quite a nice way to link them up pkg$homepage <- "https://github.com/Rafnuss/MK-RCRC" # And the url to an image describing your datapackage pkg$image <- NULL # Versioning of the datapackage is a good idea to allow update of new data. pkg$version <- "1.0.0" # You can also add keywords: pkg$keywords <- c("Mangrove Kingfisher", "Red-capped Robin Chat", "multi-sensor geolocator")  # Important field for publication/researcher # By default, the licenses of the data is Creative Common BY 4.0. # pkg$licenses # Add DOI of the datapackage if already available or reserve it https://help.zenodo.org/docs/deposit/describe-records/reserve-doi/#reserve-doi pkg$id <- "https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11207141" # Provide the recommended citation for the package pkg$citation <- "Nussbaumer, R., & Rime, Y. (2024). Woodland Kingfisher: Migration route and timing of South African Woodland Kingfisher (v1.1). Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11207141" # Funding sources pkg$grants <- c("Swiss Ornithological Intitute") # Identifiers of resources related to the package (e.g. papers, project pages, derived datasets, APIs, etc.). pkg$relatedIdentifiers <- c("Nussbaumer, R., Jackson, C. Using geolocators to unravel intra-African migrant strategies. http://dx.doi.org/10.13140/RG.2.2.34477.10721 ") # List of references related to the package pkg$references <- NULL str(pkg[!names(pkg) %in% "resources"]) package_json <- jsonlite::toJSON(pkg, pretty = TRUE, null = "null", na = "null", auto_unbox = TRUE) write(package_json, "datapackage.json")

what: 2. Create pre-filled tags.csv and observations.csv from SOI database (no data)
title: Create from SOI
text: First, need extract data access database. example, take geolocator data order OtuScoES24 add pk created earlier. warning message confirm data available dataset. However, allowed create empty observations table allow_empty_o. Note example used initial datapackage pkg, want use existing datapackage.json, can can create package pkg warning message normal, ’s reminding package actually empty. geolocator just built ready ship, can generate observations.xlsx tags.xlsx table sent ringers. suggest create .xlsx spreadsheet .csv preserve column class.
code: # Root folder of the dataset (typically the Z-drive) soi_data_directory <- "/Users/rafnuss/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/geolocator_data/UNIT_Vogelzug/"  # Load the geolocator (GDL) database from the access file gdl0 <- read_gdl(access_file = file.path(soi_data_directory, "database/GDL_Data.accdb"), filter_col = FALSE) #> Warning: One or more parsing issues, call `problems()` on your data frame for details, #> e.g.: #>   dat <- vroom(...) #>   problems(dat) pkg <- pkg %>%   add_gldp_soi(     gdl = gdl0 %>% filter(str_detect(OrderName, "OtuScoES24")),     directory_data = file.path(soi_data_directory, "data"),     allow_empty_o = TRUE, # This is required to create an empty observation table   ) #> Warning: We could not find the data directory for 49 tags (out of 49). GDL_IDs: 32TK, #> 32OD, 32UE, 32TI, 32OQ, 32SL, 32SV, 32OU, 32UF, 32TJ, 32PJ, 32UX, 32OR, 32OT, #> 32TM, 32NK, 32PI, 32UV, …, 32SS, and 32NL. These will not be imported. pkg <- read_gldp("https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Rafnuss/457b9096a4fc0ad004115df1712a8923/raw/46d5d6e4461f919f725961b037199f4fcf8313b0/datapackage.json") #> Warning: `file` #> 'https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Rafnuss/457b9096a4fc0ad004115df1712a8923/raw/46d5d6e4461f919f725961b037199f4fcf8313b0/datapackage.json' #> should have a resources property containing at least one resource. #> ℹ Use `add_resource()` to add resources. write_xlsx(tags(pkg), "./tags.xlsx") write_xlsx(observations(pkg), "./observations.xlsx")

what: 3. Create core DataPackage with data from SOI database
title: Create from SOI
text: data available Z: drive, can use function add_gldp_soi() add three core resources pkg Whenever add new resources datapackage, gldp_update() called following field updated created, temporal, reference_location, taxonomic
code: # Initiate pkg with a minimalist metadata, use exisiting datapackage.json if possible pkg <- create_gldp(   title = "Geolocator data of Cossypha natalensis in Kenya",   contributors = list(     list(       title = "Raphaël Nussbaumer",       roles = c("ContactPerson", "DataCurator", "ProjectLeader")     )   ), )  pkg <- pkg %>% add_gldp_soi(   gdl = gdl0 %>% filter(str_detect(OrderName, "CosNatKE")),   directory_data = file.path(soi_data_directory, "data") ) #> Warning: We could not find the data directory for 55 tags (out of 65). GDL_IDs: 27MK, #> 27LF, 27LC, 27MM, 27ML, 27MO, 27LE, 24SX, 24SW, 24SY, 26YC, 26YE, 28AF, 28CF, #> 28BE, 28BG, 28BF, 28BH, …, 32YS, and 30IJ. These will not be imported. #> ⠙ 4/10 ETA:  7s | #> ⠹ 5/10 ETA:  6s | #> ⠸ 7/10 ETA:  4s | print(pkg) #> A GeoLocator Data Package with 3 resourcess: #> • tags #> • measurements #> • observations #> Use `unclass()` to print the Data Package as a list.

title: Create from SOI
text: different way modify resources table. ideal case, tags.csv observations.csv returned ringer. case can simply replace case, might want edit default table. suggest create temporary .xlsx spreadsheet (.csv preserve column class), modify excel, read back R. can also edit tibble directly dplyr functions. Finally, can also modify table (recommended). vignette, ’ll just randomly create value two required field scientific_name ring_number Warning Don’t forget update meta-data information Data Package ’ve updated tables
code: tags(pkg) <- read_csv("tags.csv") # or read_xlsx() observation(pkg) <- read_csv("observations.csv") temp_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".xlsx") write_xlsx(tags(pkg), temp_file) system(paste("open", temp_file)) # Edit it on the external program and once you're done, save you file and update the table tags(pkg) <- read_xlsx(temp_file) tags(pkg) <- tags(pkg) %>%   mutate(     scientific_name = "Cossypha natalensis",     ring_number = ifelse(is.na(ring_number), "XXXXX", ring_number)   ) observations(pkg) <- observations(pkg) %>%   mutate(     ring_number = ifelse(is.na(ring_number), "XXXXX", ring_number)   ) pkg <- update_gldp(pkg)

title: Create from SOI
text: publishing data, essential validating GeoLocator Data Package. first check can done check_gldp() python package frictionless-py offers advance general validation. First ’ll need install python frictionless package,
code: check_gldp(pkg) pip install frictionless validate_gldp(pkg, path = "/Users/rafnuss/anaconda3/bin/")

title: Create from SOI
text: Now confirmed data correct, can write package Tip folder created can now uploaded Zenodo. information needed upload provided datapackage.json!
code: write_package(pkg, directory = file.path("~/", pkg$name))

title: Read and use DataPackage
text: cool feature using zenodo can load data directly Zenodo without downloading files! ’s also possible load file local directory,
code: pkg <- read_gldp("https://zenodo.org/records/13829930/files/datapackage.json") pkg <- read_gldp(file.path("~/", "woodlandkingfisher", "datapackage.json"))

title: Read and use DataPackage
text: can create GeoPressureTemplate folder data package using
code: project_dir <- write_geopressuretemplate(pkg, destdir = "~/Desktop/", overwrite = TRUE) #> Warning: 'Description' #>     * must not be empty #>     * must contain one or more complete sentences #>     * must start with a capital letter #> ✔ Setting active project to "/Users/rafnuss/Desktop/woodlandkingfisher". #> ✔ Writing 'LICENSE.md'. #> Warning: One or more parsing issues, call `problems()` on your data frame for details, #> e.g.: #>   dat <- vroom(...) #>   problems(dat)

title: Read and use DataPackage
text: Analysis tag data best performed GeoPressureR
code: id <- "16LN" withr::with_dir(project_dir, {   tag <- tag_create(id, assert_pressure = FALSE) }) #> ✔ Read './data/raw-tag/16LN/pressure.csv' #> ✔ Read './data/raw-tag/16LN/light.csv' #> ✔ Read './data/raw-tag/16LN/acceleration.csv'

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation

what: R package for GeoLocator Data Package

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: GeoLocatoR designed help create work GeoLocator Data Package (GeoLocator DP), standardized format geolocator data follows Data Package standard. flapping around messy data structures—GeoLocatoR ensures data organized, accessible, ready share world.

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: Create Geolocator Data Package: Easily create geolocator datapackage object, add resources (data), write data package preferred directory. , read existing data package directory Zenodo like pro. Works Seamlessly GeoPressureTemplate: GeoLocatoR perfectly tailored work GeoPressureTemplate—template repository analyzing geolocator data using GeoPressureR. Use dynamic duo streamline analysis, maintain standardized project structure, keep geolocator data perfect formation. (See vignette: Create GeoPressureTemplate) Supports Swiss Ornithological Institute Data: GeoLocatoR also plays nicely data Swiss Ornithological Institute. manual wrangling—just let GeoLocatoR heavy lifting! (See vignette: Create SOI) Built frictionless-r: package built top frictionless-r package, adhering Frictionless Data standards open data. Think wind beneath GeoLocatoR’s wings!

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: Data Package lightweight format packaging data using Data Package standard. provides framework organizing data files, metadata, descriptive information consistent reusable manner. geolocator data, ensures information tagged birds, movements, associated metadata neatly bundled one easily exchangeable package. GeoLocatoR takes standard applies ornithological realm, enabling structure geolocator data effectively. Learn GeoLocator DP standard .

"subset": data frame must least fields defined schema, may additional fields. Fields present schema added schema. "superset": data frame may fields present schema, must include fields defined schema. "partial": data frame must least one field defined schema.

what: Create a GeoLocator Data Package — create_gldp

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package — create_gldp
code: create_gldp(   title,   contributors,   schema = NULL,   name = NULL,   id = NULL,   licenses = list(list(name = "CC-BY-4.0", title = "Creative Commons Attribution 4.0",     path = "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/")),   description = NULL,   homepage = NULL,   image = NULL,   version = NULL,   embargo = "1970-01-01",   keywords = NULL,   citation = NULL,   grants = NULL,   related_identifiers = NULL,   references = NULL )

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package — create_gldp
text: title string providing title one sentence description package. See Data Package specification. plain text (markup), capitalised like title, end period less 65 characters. contributors list contributors, contributor list properties including leas title also optionally givenName, familyName, path, email, roles, organization. See Data Package specification . Role, suggest use R standards (aut, cre, ctb, cph fnd) see R package documentations details schema (optional) URL JSON Table Schema describes data package. Defaults GeoLocator Data Package profile. See Data Package specification . name (optional) string providing name package. Defaults slugified version title. See Data Package specification . id globally unique identifier package, UUID DOI. Defaults NULL. See Data Package specification. licenses list licenses package provided. license list properties name path optionally title. Defaults CC--4.0 license. See Data Package specification. description markdown-formatted string describing package. See Data Package specification.can (!) use multiple sentences, limited single paragraph. homepage (optional) URL home web related data package. See Data Package specification. image (optional) URL path pointing location image representing data package. See Data Package specification. version (optional) version string identifying version package, following Semantic Versioning. Defaults "1.0.0". See Data Package specification Data Package Version recipe. embargo End date embargo. Default "1970-01-01". See Data Package specification. keywords (optional) list keywords assist users searching package. See Data Package specification. citation (optional) string providing citation package. See Data Package specification. grants (optional) list grants funded creation package. See Data Package specification. related_identifiers (optional) list related identifiers package. related identifier list properties relationType relatedIdentifier. See Data Package specification. references (optional) list references package. See Data Package specification.

what: Read Geolocator Data and Orders — read_gdl
title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders — read_gdl
text: set functions facilitates reading combining Geolocator Data (GDL) associated order information various sources. main function, read_gdl(), allows reading data Access file directly separate CSV files containing GDL data order information. returns data frame integrates GDL data summarized order details.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders — read_gdl
code: read_gdl(access_file = NA, file_data = NA, file_order = NA, filter_col = TRUE)  read_gdl_orders(file_order)  read_gdl_data(file_data)  read_gdl_access(   access_file,   file_data = tempfile("GDL_Data", fileext = "csv"),   file_order = tempfile("GDL_Orders", fileext = "csv") )

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders — read_gdl
text: access_file string specifying path Access file containing GDL data order information. provided, takes precedence file_data file_order. Defaults NA.  § file_data string specifying path GDL data file. Required access_file provided. Defaults NA. file_order string specifying path GDL order file. Required access_file provided. Defaults NA. filter_col logical value character vector. TRUE, predefined set columns selected. FALSE, columns included. Alternatively, character vector can passed specify columns select. Defaults TRUE.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders — read_gdl
text: data frame combining GDL data summarized order information. data frame includes columns OrderName, Client, NumberDelivered, GDL_ID, Species, , depending value filter_col.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders — read_gdl
text: read_gdl() function primary interface reading combining GDL data orders. can read Access file separate data order files. Access file provided, read_gdl_access() function used extract GDL data order information. Otherwise, read_gdl_data() read_gdl_orders() functions employed read data specified CSV files. read_gdl(): Reads GDL order data, either Access file separate CSV files, returns combined data frame. read_gdl_orders(): Reads GDL order information CSV file, including columns like OrderID, OrderName, Species, Client, NumberDelivered. read_gdl_data(): Reads GDL data CSV file, including columns like DataID, OrderName, GDL_ID, Species, spatial temporal information. read_gdl_access(): Extracts GDL data order information Access database file exports temporary CSV files.

title: Transform Tags to a Tidy Data Frame — tags2m
text: tibble (data frame) columns: tag_id character vector representing unique identifier tag. sensor character vector representing type sensor measurement, including types like "activity", "pitch", "light", "temperature_external", etc. datetime POSIXct datetime object representing timestamp measurements. value numeric vector containing sensor measurement values. label character vector additional labeling, NA present original data.

title: Transform Tags to a Tidy Data Frame — tags2m
text: tags2m() function extracts processes sensor data list tags. renames value column corresponding sensor type exists, ensures presence label column, reshapes data long format. function handles various sensor types pressure, acceleration, light, temperature, magnetic fields. tags provided, function returns empty tibble appropriate column names types.

title: Update a GeoLocator Data Package Metadata — update_gldp
text: function performs following updates: Sets created field current date time RFC3339 format. Updates temporal field date range datetime values measurements resource, available. Updates taxonomic field unique, non-missing scientific_name values tags resource, available. Sets reference_location field median latitude longitude values observations resource, available.

title: Create a Geopressure Template Project — write_geopressuretemplate
text: pkg list containing package metadata, including name, title, description, version, licenses, contributors. destdir character string specifying destination directory project created. Default current directory ("."). project_name character string sets name project. Default derived pkg$name. overwrite logical value indicating whether overwrite existing directory name. Default FALSE.

title: Create a Geopressure Template Project — write_geopressuretemplate
text: path created project directory.

title: Create a Geopressure Template Project — write_geopressuretemplate
text: Upon execution, function performs following steps: Creates project directory. Generates DESCRIPTION file using metadata pkg. Creates README file outlines project details. Generates LICENSE file based specified licenses. Writes relevant data files project structure.
